content: mini yipyip fob abbreviations/terms used magic_ring - magic_ring single_crochet - single_crochet blo - back loop only chain - chain slip_stitch - slip_stitch materials * - repeat instructions inside size 4 yarn in body and eye colour parenthesis until the end of the 3 25mm crochet hook round/row scissors total number of stitches will be safety eyes googly eyes pompoms noted in at the end of each or black yarn for stitching instruction ie 6 is 6 stitches in the keychain ring or other affixing round/row device increase - increase in the stitch decrease - decrease across 2 stitches fo - fasten_off you can view the tutorial on youtube at https //youtu be/_j1uwecb5u8 si=plhlnbgl5kdzby8i if link is not live please copy and paste into your browser body in yarn colour of your choice 1 single_crochet 6 in a magic_ring 6 - see figure 1 2 increase * 12 3 increase single_crochet * 18 4 blo single_crochet around 18 - see figure 2 5-7 single_crochet around 18 - see figure 3 here we stop working in rounds and figure 1 figure 2 work in row - ch1 and turn at the beginning of each row 8 ch1 turn your work single_crochet 12 across leaving the remaining stitches unworked 12 - see figure 4 9 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 8 decrease 10 10 ch1 turn single_crochet 10 10 11 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 6 decrease 8 12 ch1 turn single_crochet 8 8 13 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 4 decrease 6 - see figure 5 we will now rotate our work to single_crochet around the figure 4 - the mouth opening of the mouth has begun working down the side of the mouth opening that is figure 3 facing out single_crochet evenly down the mouth sc6 across the bottom of the opening and single_crochet evenly up the remaining side see figure 6&7 we will now join both sides of the opening together and resume working in rounds - see figure 8 14 slip_stitch to the last single_crochet in row 13 turn your work so you are working on the right side/outside of the yip and sc6 around 15 press the sides of the top together and slst3 figure 5 - you have figure 6 - single_crochet evenly through both which will close the opening fo built up the back down side of mouth leaving a long tail for sewing your choice of ring/fob to the top see figure 12 figure 7 figure 8 tendrils cut 18 lengths of 4-6 yarn to attach to each fl remaining at outside of base fold tendril in half push your hook under the fl place middle of tendril at the fold on the hook and pull under the fl keeping the tendril on the hook take both remaining ends of the tendril and yarn over the hook pulling them through the folded tendril this creates a snug hold see figure 9-12 figure 9 figure 10 eyes - make 2 with yarn in eye colour 1 sc4 in magic_ring
